column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Bavarian alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. Someone who constantly attends social events (and thus is literally "there as well"); someone with a feeling of importance and the desire of belonging to high society.

noun
  1. (anatomy) eye
  2. (on plants, esp. potatoes, grapevines and fruit trees) germ, bud; eye (potato)
  3. (on dice) dot, pip, spot
  4. (of a cyclonic storm) eye
  5. (on the surface of liquids, e.g. soup) drop or globule of grease or fat

noun
  1. (Vienna) a beating, a caning
  2. (Vienna) clubs (playing card suit)

name
  1. Bavarian (a German dialect spoken in Bavaria and Austria)

noun
  1. beechnut, beech nut (the fruit of the beech tree)

noun
  1. beechnut, beech nut (the fruit of the beech tree)

noun
  1. (Wienerisch) a very skinny, still young person

noun
  1. (Vienna) common toad (Bufo bufo)
  2. (Vienna) a contemptible person

noun
  1. coffee (beverage made by infusing the beans of the coffee plant in hot water)

noun
  1. (chiefly Austria) smelly foot or feet (usually used in the plural)

noun
  1. (East Central Bavaria, chiefly Vienna, derogatory) idiot, fool

noun
  1. (Obderennsisch, humorous) a person with a skinny, weak body

name
  1. Munich (the capital and largest city of Bavaria, Germany)

noun
  1. Obatzda or Obazda, a Bavarian cheese delicacy

noun
  1. empire or significant State
  2. realm (also e.g. of plants)

noun
  1. a slap across the face
  2. (card games) bells

noun
  1. An impractical idea which seems brilliant when one is drunk.

name
  1. (Vienna) Vienna (the capital city of Austria)
  2. (Vienna) Wien (a river in Vienna, Austria)

adv
  1. once, one time (one and only one time)
  2. once (formerly; during some period in the past)
  3. sometime (at an indefinite but stated time in the past or future)
  4. first of all, firstly (as an initial point; before any other considerations)

verb
  1. (chiefly East Central Bavaria, Vienna) to doze, to nap, to sleep

noun
  1. (Sappada, Sauris, Timau) Alternative form of Haus: house

verb
  1. (auxiliary) can, to be able to
  2. to know, to be acquainted with; to be familiar with
  3. to recognize, perceive

verb
  1. (Vienna, baseball, softball) to bat
  2. (Vienna, soccer) to play football

verb
  1. (transitive, intransitive) to shoot
  2. (intransitive) to run
  3. (transitive) to deceive
  4. (intransitive) to shoot up
  5. (Vienna, intransitive) to be on the lookout for girls

noun
  1. (Sappada, Sauris, Timau) the German language, especially Standard German

noun
  1. (Timau) the Southern Bavarian dialect of Timau

noun
  1. carriage, coach (wheeled vehicle, generally drawn by horse power)
  2. cart, trolley (small, open, wheeled vehicle)
  3. automobile, car
  4. cab, taxi
  5. car, carriage, coach (railroad car)
  6. carriage (part of typewriter)

pron
  1. (East Central Bavarian, Vienna) much

det
  1. (East Central Bavarian, Vienna) much, many

verb
  1. (Vienna, transitive) to pull
  2. (Vienna, intransitive) to move; to migrate

prep
  1. (Vienna, of location, + dative) between
  2. (Vienna, of motion, + accusative) between
